page.title: 03Newtown Mart
page.content: On auction days farmers gather on the circular stone tiers around the sawdust-covered ring.A bell rings,the auctioneer emerges,men with sticks drive the animals into the ring and the auctioneer begins bidding,speaking so fast that his voice sounds like a tape going fast forward.The farmers nod or raise a finger to him to make a bid. Twenty people work at the mart.Some work in the office where a computer is used to store information on prices etc.Manual workers help to unload the lorries. Boys from Newtown school look forward to Mondays and Thursdays when they regularly go down to the mart to watch the auctions and to help out when they are needed unloading cattle etc.
